t: Now*p the Spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;
Speaking*p lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;
Forbidding*p to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.
For*p every creature of God is good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:
For*p it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
If*p thou put the brethren in remembrance of these things, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.
But*p refuse profane and old wives' fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.
For*p bodily exercise profiteth little: but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.
This*p is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.
For*p therefore we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.
Let*p no man despise thy youth; but be thou an example of the believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.
Till*p I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.
Neglect*p not the gift that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery.
Meditate*p upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.
Take*p heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continue in them: for in doing this thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear thee.
